clues.clue: The Battle of Fort Sumter kicks things off; the Pony Express rides (but never becomes Pon-Ex)
Westerners learn where Tiananmen Square is; Live Aid rocks
The Constitution is written; John Jameson uses a new process to make Irish whiskey
The Pinta sights land; Savonarola falls & Machiavelli begins to rise in Florence
The AFL & CIO merge; John Foster Dulles is Secretary of State
"What's in your wallet?" Oh, it's a ticket to the Orange Bowl sponsored by this bank
Baylor ended up in better hands than Ole Miss in the 88th Sugar Bowl underwritten by this insurance company
The 2021 Famous Idaho Potato Bowl got served up in this state capital
In 2022 Bad Boy Mowers kicked off its sponsorship of the Pinstripe Bowl in this stadium that's a bit better known for baseball
The 2021 TransPerfect Music City Bowl was held in this city, y'all
California's state fabric is this jeans material that became a hit in the gold rush
Also the name of a famous boat, it's fitting that this is the state flower of Massachusetts
The state mammal of Nebraska is the white-tailed this
A state sport of Colorado involves racing these small donkeys
Laissez les bon temps rouler with this treat, Louisiana's state doughnut
In the first chapter of "A Christmas Carol", this word is used 8 times; in the last chapter, not at all
In business it's the opposite of a deficit
4-letter word for the heart of the matter, the central, critical point
"Up to" this means "in good shape", not ready for some tobacco
It describes a hero who receives no praise, in music or otherwise
This sidekick to Stewie on "Family Guy" has revealed he was once the sidekick of McGruff the Crime Dog
Computer whiz Chloe O'Brian was introduced on Season 3 (or Day 3) of this drama
Ron Stoppable is the trusted sidekick of this animated high school crime fighter
Now a bestselling author with "I'm Glad My Mom Died", Jennette McCurdy was sidekick Sam to Miranda Cosgrove on this show
Kenan Thompson's recent sitcom co-starred this "Saturday Night Live" castmate
(Ginger Zee presents the clue.) The first big storm that I covered was this hurricane that slammed into the Gulf Coast in 2005 with major impacts in New Orleans, coastal Mississippi & Alabama

(Ginger Zee presents the clue.) In early 2020, I was in Australia to cover its unprecedented wildfires & learn how the hottest & driest year on record had parched giant stretches of these native trees filled with extremely flammable oil
(Ginger Zee presents the clue.) Severe weather events can be predicted earlier & more accurately, thanks to radar using the frequency shifting event named for this man
(Ginger Zee presents the clue.) In 2020, I visited this natural wonder on the Zambezi River to see firsthand how it had recovered from drought that had reduced its spectacular flow to a mere trickle
(Ginger Zee presents the clue.) Ironically, propeller planes were the first to encounter this atmospheric region of high-speed wind that affects weather across the globe
Oh my gods! This 9,600-foot Greek peak is on the border of the regions Macedonia & Thessaly
In 2021 this national park reported its hottest-ever June, with an average day/night temperature of 102.8
Valles Marineris, seen here on this planet, is 2,500 miles long & 6 miles deep; the Grand Canyon goes 277 & 1, respectfully
13,165-foot Cloud Peak is the highest peak in this Wyoming mountain range whose name reflects a type of sheep
An underground wonderland, Virginia's Luray Caverns are located in this scenic valley
Christopher Robin joined Pooh & friends for new adventures in a 2009 authorized sequel called "Return to" this wood
"Insurgent" is Book 2 in this dystopian series
"'Tis" was Frank McCourt's follow-up to this Pulitzer-winning memoir about his impoverished upbringing in Ireland
It's the fitting 2-word title of Jojo Moyes' sequel to "Me Before You", about Louisa Clark following the death of Will Traynor
Margaret Atwood won the Booker Prize for this sequel to "The Handmaid's Tale" that's narrated by Daisy, Agnes & Aunt Lydia
Seen here, this Brazilian-born woman says she launched the Luz Foundation to bring light into the world
Ernesto was the real first name of this revolutionary leader; his famous nickname is an Argentinean interjection
Colombian author Gabriel Garcia Marquez was a founder of this "fantastic" literary genre

clues.answer: the Secretary-General of the United Nations
clues.clue: As the fifth man in this job, Javier Perez de Cuellar of Peru helped end wars & helped get the Soviets out of Afghanistan
The documentary "The Judge & the General" is about Juan Guzman, who investigated this Chilean dictator & in 2000 indicted him
It's the type of angle seen here. Correct?
"Angle of" precedes this word, which in chess means to threaten a piece with capture
Also 3 letters, this feature is similar to a bow window, but with sharp angles instead of a gentle sweep
At a 38-degree angle, or 78% gradient, Harakiri is the steepest ski slope in this nation of skiers Franz Klammer & Hermann Maier
This "national" angle that actually originated in Germany tilts on a camera's roll axis & is used to create an uneasy feeling
Princess who said, "Help me, Obi-Wan Kenobi. you're my only hope"
First name of "2001" astronaut Bowman, who has some tense dialogue with HAL
Last name of alien-slaying Ellen, who wants to nuke the entire site from orbit
Alliterative time traveler also known as Calvin Klein
Alliterative Wall Street "lizard" who insists that greed is good
If an I gets poked out, one who gets property in a will becomes a third person pronoun
To relinquish certain rights, & how you can say goodbye to those rights after the I leaves
You "show" this when you maintain composure; when I leaves, you "strike" this second word when your picture is taken
Make an I disappear & presto! A mental picture becomes an olden word for a wizard
Without an I, an adjective describing a shade like indigo becomes an action that shades you crimson

final_jeopardy.clue: He was sworn in twice as president within 2 years, first by his father & then later by a former U.S. President
